Combine Strict and Experimental Period Crosswalks

Source: R/experimental-period-identification.R
combine_period_crosswalks.Rd

Merges a strict crosswalk from pnadc_identify_periods() with an experimental crosswalk from pnadc_experimental_periods(), filling in undetermined periods from the strict crosswalk with experimental assignments.

Usage

combine_period_crosswalks(
  strict_crosswalk,
  experimental_crosswalk,
  priority = c("strict", "experimental"),
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

strict_crosswalk

data.table from pnadc_identify_periods()

experimental_crosswalk

data.table from pnadc_experimental_periods() with include_derived = FALSE (experimental columns only)

priority

Character. Which source takes priority when both have assignments. Default "strict" means strict determinations are never overwritten. Use "experimental" to prefer experimental assignments (rarely needed).

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, print summary of combined assignments.

Value

A combined crosswalk data.table with:

  • All columns from strict crosswalk

  • Experimental columns (ref_month_exp, etc.)

  • probabilistic_assignment: TRUE for rows where experimental assignment was used to fill a gap

The combined crosswalk is ready for use with pnadc_apply_periods().

Details

This function is useful when you want to:

  • Keep strict and experimental crosswalks separate

  • Apply different confidence thresholds to experimental assignments

  • Audit which assignments came from which source

If you just want experimental assignments integrated automatically, use pnadc_experimental_periods() with include_derived = TRUE.

See also

pnadc_identify_periods, pnadc_experimental_periods

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Build strict crosswalk
strict <- pnadc_identify_periods(pnadc_data)

# Build experimental crosswalk (without derived columns)
experimental <- pnadc_experimental_periods(
  strict,
  pnadc_data,
  strategy = "probabilistic",
  confidence_threshold = 0.95,
  include_derived = FALSE
)

# Combine them
combined <- combine_period_crosswalks(strict, experimental)

# Use with calibration
result <- pnadc_apply_periods(pnadc_data, combined,
                              period = "month", calibrate = TRUE)
} # }
